alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:03PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Goshen, northwestern Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 603 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Chugwater, or 23 miles south of Wheatland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chugwater and Slater. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 47 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills
